com.sl.algorithms.sort.finitegroups

Class PolishNationalFlagSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sl.algorithms.sort.finitegroups.PolishNationalFlagSort<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseInterface<T>, Constants, SortingEngine<T>

    public class PolishNationalFlagSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements SortingEngine<T>

    A precursor to DutchNationalFlagSort, inspired by Wei-Mei Chen's paper.

        _white - : primary value for sort.
        i.e. everything else is red and can be any value hence will settle in the right.

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public void sort(T[] A)

        Approach:

        The two indices 'w' and 'r' keep track of the white and red block boundaries, respectively.
        First, we scan from the left end of the array by incrementing 'w' until we find a !white element, and we scan from the right end of the array by decrementing 'r' until we find a white element. We then exchange the two elements. Continue this way until 'w' and 'r' meet.
        Note that the scanning process is the same as that of the partition procedure of QuickSort or QuickSelectMedianFinder.

        Specified by:
        sort in interface SortingEngine<T extends java.lang.Comparable>

        public ListNode<T> sortList(ListNode<T> list)
